attributes.action: Ask Theresa May to acknowledge that women have 6 year wait for their pensions
attributes.additional_details:
We feel it is wrong to disregard such an important issue when discussing the hardship that 50's women are experiencing due to the 6 year wait, especially as they were not notified of the 1995 Act.
We ask that the Prime Minister acknowledges in Parliament the fact that 50's women do in fact have a 6 years wait for their pensions and advise other MP's to do the same
attributes.background: We note the PM's responses are always the same that "no-one will have to wait longer than 18 mths" to receive their pensions, we feel this is mis-leading as this only refers to the 2011 Act, when 50's women also bear the brunt of the '95 Act where 5 yrs were also added to their SPA = 6 years

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do. For example, you could ask the Government to make a clear statement to Parliament about the effect of changes to the state pension age since 1995.
